author: Special Correspondent
text:
The second day events of Coimbatore Vizha, especially the special exhibition of old items titled “Coimbatore through ages” drew many visitors.

The exhibits threw an insight into the lifestyle of people then.

The Coimbatore Vizha special exhibition at Lakshmi Mills and various other exhibits which showcased the history of Coimbatore and its development in an innovative manner enthralled the visitors.

“Original Early – Mid 20{+t}{+h}Century Tamil Art” by Raja Ravi Varma Art Foundation provided a feast to the eyes of the visitors at the Jenny’s Club.

Events related to health and music were organised at the Brookfields mall. These events were followed by a musical treat for the audience from Tech Music by PSG.

Tour

The ‘Coimbatore Vizha Special City Tour’ also received an overwhelming response from the public with more than 100 people registering for the tour.

The tour is free and open to the public at 10 a.m. and 3 p.m. For more information on booking, contact 80564 23456

Jewellery exhibition

As a part of the Coimbatore Vizha, Kirtilals is exhibiting a gallery on the evolution of jewellery at Kirtilals Showroom on Raja Street till February 4.

The exclusive museum-cum-exhibition depicts how the trends and designs in jewellery have changed over the last seven decades, according to Suraj Shantakumar, director, Business Strategy.
title: Coimbatore Vizha events attract visitors
